events.message: The customer submitted a claim after their car was involved in a minor collision at a traffic light, reporting front bumper damage.
Claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to vehicle collision details provided in the report.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the car accident claim and to contact the customer for further information.
Customer received acknowledgment of claim receipt and was informed about the next steps in the processing procedure.
Customer requested to provide photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and a copy of the driver’s license.
All required documents including photos of damages and official police accident report have been submitted by the customer.
Assigned investigator began review of submitted evidence and contacted involved parties to verify accident circumstances.
Investigation concluded that the accident was caused by another driver running a red light; liability is clear.
A settlement offer covering repair costs, rental car reimbursement, and minor medical expenses has been proposed to the customer.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling and fair offer, requesting to proceed with the settlement.
Claim officially approved based on investigation findings and customer acceptance of the proposed settlement terms.
Payment for the approved settlement was processed and transferred to the customer’s account successfully.
The insurance claim case was closed after all payments were settled and the customer confirmed repair completion.
All files and communications related to the auto accident claim were archived per company data retention policy.
